title: Deep Learning-Based Soil Sampling Location Selection Project: Sustainable Agricultural Solutions Through Geospatial-Environmental Variable Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience (basic geographic information systems, introduction to environmental science, understanding of agricultural policies)
context.additional_context: A field data collection and analysis-centered education utilizing smartphone apps, emphasizing a citizen science approach to solving local community issues. Learners collaborate with farmers and local government officials to explore sustainable land management strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of optimizing sampling locations using five soil properties (slope, NDVI, soil type, moisture content, organic matter distribution) and geo-environmental variables.
Learners can apply procedures for processing agricultural field data using deep learning-based image analysis tools while considering the social implications of spatial data interpretation.

Learners can select one soil pollution case in a local agricultural setting using PBL (Problem-Based Learning), create a GIS-based soil sampling plan, conduct at least three field surveys, and produce an analysis report including five items (soil pH, heavy metal concentration, organic matter content, water retention, microbial diversity).
Learners can explain the basic concepts of transformer model-based spatial analysis and propose ways to link them to regional development policies.
Learners can visualize soil data using smartphone apps in limited technological environments and establish communication strategies to share results with local community stakeholders.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
